185951885.review: Incredibly fun to play, even after all these years later.

185946624.review: 老牌游戏了，第一次接触还是2011年左右呢。作为 EA 红警系列的一代经典作品，没有红警2（尤其是共和国之辉）那么有名，也没有 星际争霸 那么有竞技性，但必须说这是一部在战略、玩法上有十足设计的游戏，社区给这个游戏打的mod也层出不穷，有很多非常有创意的模组，曾经的龙霸天下、Zero是，现在的Remix、日冕也是。未来的红警3不只是一个游戏，更是玩家社区发挥自己想象力的平台和沙盒。在实习有钱后支持一下游戏，也算是支持下自己逝去的青春，补票了。我想大多数朋友来这里也和我一样是重拾童年的乐趣；但如果你是被日冕mod吸引而来的，那么请你一定要尝试下这款游戏：本体和模组都设计得很用心，你也一定会玩得愉快的。

185405473.review:
[h1][i]“Who knows what nightmares we have created?”[/i]
~Dr. Zelinsky[/h1]

2008 was at its end and I must say, I was really excited. All of the sudden, after trying all sorts of new stuff (from dropping the original lore in [b]Generals[/b] to turning the series into an f2p thing), [b]EA[/b] took the U-turn and went all old-school in their [b]C&C3[/b]. [b]Tiberium Wars[/b], while not being perfect, was a big surprise to old fans like me, who were ready to give up on a thing they used to love back in the days. Long story short, [b]EA[/b] took the original [b]C&C[/b] from 1995 and, well, gave us the next-gen version of it. All the advanced stuff [b]Westwood[/b] planned for their own version of [b]C&C3[/b] was dropped, but honestly, at that point it didn't matter. What mattered is that we finally got our [b]C&C[/b] back. Now they've promised us [b]Red Alert[/b] and naturally, what I expected was the same thing, but with the ships. Because that's what the original [b]RA[/b] was – same ol' [b]C&C[/b], just with the naval battles and some new features, right? Well, turned out I was wrong. Dead wrong.

Naturally, [b]RA3[/b] follows the [b]RA2[/b] formula. And that is something to be expected. [b]RA2[/b], despite insulting some old-school fans, was warmly welcomed and, let's admit it, after it became a thing, there was no turning back. The original concept was no more. Shared universe, the dark tone, the alternative history... Well, maybe not the alternative history. I mean, the original 1996 game was all about “What if?...” thing, in which [b]Westwood[/b] tried to imagine the world without [b]Adolf Hitler[/b]. Naturally, with Nazi Germany and the USSR being allies (they've signed a pact and then both invaded Poland the next month), it was USSR to start the world war in [b]Westwood[/b]'s game. [b]EA[/b]? Well, they went even further back to the past. Even though it's generally considered that WWII began in 1939, in Asia it was going since 1937 (Second Sino-Japanese War), so... Yeah. We've got Japan. As a third playable faction.

Sounds rather smart, but like I said, don't expect anything serious here. [b]RA3[/b] is all about “OMG, LOL!” moments its predecessor was known for. Let's just say that Japanese forces here have a giant mecha kaijū with the light swords and forget about it, OK? [b]RA3[/b] is like [b]RA2[/b] on drugs. And, like [b]Joey Tribbiani[/b], it's not even sorry. No, seriously, it takes pride in everything. [b]RA2[/b] was cheesy? [b]RA3[/b] is probably [i]the[/i] cheesiest thing in AAA gaming.[b]RA2[/b] sexualized women? [b]RA3[/b] feels like it was made by [b]Larry Laffer[/b] and [b]Vince McMahon[/b]. Et cetera, et cetera. And yes, [b]EA[/b] threw in Hollywood cast again. We've got [b]Tim Curry[/b], Japanese Emperor is played by [b]Star Trek[/b] legend [b]George Takei[/b], the American president is [b]J.K. Simmons[/b] (AKA [i]the[/i] [b]J. Jonah Jameson[/b])... Even that dumbass [b]Gina Carano[/b] is in this game, which is a nice fit for her for a change. [i]Anyway[/i]. Like I said, all that is to be expected. [b]EA[/b] liked the direction [b]RA[/b] took in the second game, they had the money... No surprise here. What shocked me was that... This game is nothing like [b]C&C3[/b]. You know what we've got instead of it? We've got [b]Generals 2[/b]. For consoles. Say wha-a-a-a-a-a-a...

I'm serious, though. I wish I wasn't, but I am. You know how sometimes the main series doesn't really fit on consoles, but publisher still wants it to be represented there? They make consoles-oriented spin-off. Something like, say, [b]Sid Meier’s Civilization: Revolution[/b]. Something that aims for consoles audience, yet still somewhat akin to what PC counterpart was about. [b]RA3[/b]? Is exactly that. While [b]C&C3[/b] was on [b]Xbox 360[/b] too, [b]RA3[/b] is also on [b]PS3[/b]. And we all know just how much “fun” developing things for [b]PS3[/b] was (yes, that's, most likely, why we still didn't get [b]Disgaea 3[/b] in [b]Steam[/b]). As the result... Well... [b]RA3[/b] looks like a console game, [b]RA3[/b] feels like a console game and in a nutshell, [b]RA3[/b] [i]is[/i] a console game. Tiny maps, [i]huge[/i] fonts... You know the drill. It wasn't time for [b]Dragon Age II[/b] yet, but yes, that's the stuff. Really wonder why there's no gamepad support here, because, unlike [b]C&C3[/b], this game doesn't feel natural on PC.

Which... doesn't mean that it's bad. Exactly the opposite, it's [i]incredibly[/i] fun. And that's... the worst thing about it. I'll explain why in a moment. For now, let's get back to [b]Generals[/b]. Like I already mentioned, gameplay-wise [b]EA Los Angeles[/b] didn't even try to deliver [b]RA3[/b] here. They've just gave us [b]Generals 2[/b]. We've got, well, generals again, with all of their levels and abilities back, [b]Spice[/b] / [b]Tiberium[/b] mechanics is no more and we've got [b]WarCraft[/b]-like thingy from [b]Generals[/b], we can build anywhere (with some “buts”, but still), etc. Which technically does sound like an arguable decision, but the thing is – there's one thing to justify all that. That thing is co-op. The whole thing is co-op-oriented. And even if you'll decide to play solo, you'll still share the map with your AI companion. All of those [b]Generals[/b] elements were added for one single purpose – to make this game as quick and smooth as possible in co-op. See where this is going?

Yes, [b]RA3[/b] is one of [i]those[/i] games. At the moment I write this, all of us can name at least some series that were heavily ruined by such an approach. [b]MachineGames[/b]' [b]Wolfenstein[/b], [b]Dead Island[/b]... [b]RA3[/b], on the other hand? It won [i]a lot[/i] from it. Yes, it was all about tiny maps with not enough space for, you know, strategy. We were just teaming up in order to do some obvious tasks, but since the game was fast-paced (ish, speed slider still isn't a thing) and satisfying? It was just... Like I said, [i]fun[/i]. Up to this day, [b]RA3[/b] is one of the funniest things you can play if all you want is just some quick RTS sessions. The factions are great and unique (all three feel totally different from each other), units are surprisingly complicated and sometimes even allow us to switch between different abilities, while the UI is totally fine and won't make you break your pace. Even the single player campaign (10 missions per faction) is not that bad. Even though yes, it does suffer from [b]Generals[/b] problem, where it'll change goals on the way (which will lead to some pretty unfair surprises to you). Still, the main dish here is a co-op. It's smooth, it's fun and it's hard not to praise [b]EA LA[/b] for what they've achieved with it. Like I said, though, it was not a good thing for the series.

Why? Think about it. What we have here is a co-op oriented spin-off for consoles. Which was sold as a real deal, as a part of main series. And it sold well. People loved it. Still do (despite the original [b]GameSpy[/b]-based multiplayer being dead, there's still a third-party way to play online). Which made [b]EA[/b] to believe that... That's what people want. That this here is how the series should be in the future. Not about old-school stuff, but about fast-paced short sessions online. Most of the people blame [b]C&C4[/b] for killing the series for good. That's how they've remembered it. But the truth is – it wasn't [b]Tiberium Twilight[/b] that fired the poisoned bullet. This game did. Yet nobody hated it for that. Because it was [i]crazy[/i] fun. Now, you may ask how did my old friend felt about it? You know, the man I've mentioned in my [b]RA2[/b] review? The one we disagreed about series' new look with? Well, we'll never know. Because at the moment of 2008 he was long dead. And there's some moral in that, I guess. You never know how things will turn out the next day. [b]RA 3[/b]? It was one of them crazy turns. Worked great in a moment, but... Then again, let's talk about that in the [b]C&C4[/b] review.

Obviously we all play Red Alert 3 for "the plot" :)

Seriously, though... this still delivers some 20 years later.  The default install allows 4k resolution - which surprised me.  The zoom is too close/tight for my liking but you adjust to it after a while.

The acting is hilarious 20 years later, but it was never intended to be Oscar award winning and the tongue-in-cheek appeal is still there, 100% intact and cracking me up as I plow through the Allied campaign on my way to the "Oh myyyyy" campaign, so to speak :)

Отличная игра. Не думал что в начале 2025-го года будет приятно вернуться в нее. Ой как задорно  было проходить кампании за все фракции, смотря качественные ролики с живым актерами, и смеясь с общей нелепости и клюквы в сюжете и лоре. Сейчас подобную игру уже трудно представить, особенно от крупной корпорации дерьма, коей EA являются по сей день. 
Поэтому такие проекты по своему ценны в нынешние времена. И если вы любитель подобных RTS и давно еще пропустили игру - то и сейчас оценить стоит.

184926539.review:
Если вы берете для игру для посиделок по сети, то EA наложила вам лепёху. 
Инет сеть давно сдохла, по локалке через хамачи требует cd key. Но прикол в том что его нет, надо лезть в реестр и прописывать самому по пути HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Electronic Arts\Electronic Arts\Red Alert 3\ergc 
Но там файл пустой, и прописав любой ключ, после запуска игры он обнуляет XD. Лечится только путем запуска игры, после правки реестра. И так каждый раз. Хочешь посети, запустил игру, поравил ключ играей. 

Самое смешное, что на пиратке таких бубнов нет!

184835538.review:
He vuelto a jugar al Red Alert 3, ya lo terminé en su día y me pareció un juego muy divertido, ahora lo compré en una oferta de toda la saga por 4 euros, y lo he vuelto a jugar.

Me sorprende las pocas horas que marca registradas, yo juraría que lo he jugado bastantes más. También he de decir que aunque ponga que no está en castellano el juego está completamente traducido, tanto los textos como los diálogos y las cinemáticas. 

El juego ofrece una estrategia rápida, de pocos edificios y con una gestión de recursos automatizada y simple, propio de toda la saga, introduce 3 facciones, dos venían de los juegos originales, metiendo una nueva, los japoneses. 

Por lo demás la historia se establece en un universo alternativo donde no se ha desarrollado la bomba nuclear lo cual ha generado un conflicto abierto entre aliados y sovieticos, conflicto en el que se introducen los japoneses. 

La campaña es divertida, con ese toque de la saga de meter actores reales, algunos de segunda fila, otros más reconocibles. En este juego se adopta un punto de vista más adulto en las cinemáticas, optando por un pequeño toque de erotismo en los uniformes y los enlaces tácticos.

Lo lamentable del juego es que en su inicio se pensó como un juego cooperativo, y tanto la campaña como el multijugador se diseñaron para jugarse entre dos personas, lo cual a mi gusto no le hace bien a la campaña. Los escenarios de la campaña son variados pero siempre son partidas de 2 players, la IA es inexistente en tu compañero al cual debes dar instrucciones concretas. El nivel de dificultad no es nada retador, por lo que el juego a día de hoy sin multijugador acaba siendo el disfrute de jugar una campaña para conocer la historia que propone. 

Otro aspecto negativo es que los gráficos han sufrido mucho el paso del tiempo, es curioso, porque los pixelacos de los juegos originales, 1 y 2, a día de hoy se sienten cómodos, pero el aspecto gráfico del 3 ha envejecido más que un queso puesto al sol. 

Lo recomiendo, porque sigue siendo divertido a día de hoy, ofrece una estrategia muy fluida, con variedad de opciones tácticas, y una historia con un toque de humor tremendo, me encanta que parodian al presidente de estados unidos, el cual hace discursos encorsetados que en su época eran una satira pero que a día de hoy son la norma del país.

Одна з небагатьох найкращих RTS'ок, які я грав у своєму дитинстві.

Попередні частини я хоч й не грав, але поверхово нам дають знати через вступ що було та що є каноном в цій грі. Механіка повітряних, морських боїв дуже захопливі та цікаві.
Кампанії теж цікаві, чого варта кампанія за Альянс, або за Совєтов чи за Імперію. Варто сказати, що мультиплеєр по ній живий завдяки ентузіастам, тому я не можу сказати як грається з іншими гравцями на своєму досвіді.

184438486.review:
Not as good as the other C&C games, because of Ubisoft, not the developers, they did their best. Actors are fun to watch I guess, though not exactly compelling in game. They at least look like they had fun, especially Tim Curry. Bloopers are worth tracking down, as well as the memes these performances spawned. The factions are not balanced, you'll be having a problem getting any good anti-air throughout all the campaigns, unless you're the Allies who are WAY better than the the other 2 factions combined. There's no contest. The Allies also have the best campaign out of the 3, with the most interesting missions and narrative, even if the plot progresses because your boss is an idiot. And it's the campaign where Tim Curry says "the line"!! 

The New Japanese faction has the weakest units in the entire game because their gimmick of switching units from ground/sea to air make them extremely vulnerable if the Russians or Allies have a mix of anti-Ground/Air units, which they always do. This becomes blatantly apparent during the Japanese's Hawaii mission which gives you 3 anti-air units, the Turret (Which takes time to set up, and is easily destroyed anyway), the helicopter (Which only becomes anti-air on land, and the Allies base is specifically in the water), and the Mecha Tengu (Which are brittle, weak, and need to be in jet-mode to become anti-air). While the Allies have strong anti-air Jets, turrets and 2 different boats. And if you wanna switch you're Tengu to ground mode to protect the Battleships you get later (Which are necessary to win, believe me) they'll be massacred, along with any ships you've built, by Cryocopters, Dophins, Battleships, the same anti-air turrets and 2 boats mentioned earlier (Because they can attack air and ground units. How Novel!!), Electric towers if you get too close to their base, and Aircraft Carrier's that can infinitely spawn smaller planes that can hit anything FAAAARRR outside their own field of view... 

They also just feel weird to me. Like, the game uses stereotypes for theming and characterisation, which I just think is lazy, but it's whatever. But, when it's applied to the Japanese, they end up feeling "oriental". They're going for the specific bushido, honour, Shogun era tone, mixed with High-tech, late 2000's anime tropes (by people who, I feel like, have never actually watched any anime, set to the backdrop of being the fascist WW2 version of Japan... and it feels very gross! Especially when these traits are shared with all their units. None of the units have a unique personality, outside of their "role/job", which again because it's the fascism faction, feels gross. So, good job?

The Music fucks though! definitely check the ost.

184303969.review:
All time classic of the RTS genre , expect to expect Command and Conquer !

I was excited to play this again, and then EA happened(the april updates). Forces telemetry, lag due to the forced telemetry(and what seems like some kind of DRM?) and then soft locking your PC for you when you try to disable said forced telemetry and/or change some graphic settings. 

If you have the old variant, from a disc or if there is a GOG variant(that are always DRM free), then go for that as that version is awesome and I warmly recommend it. This one that has been force-updated due to the new "ultimate" collection(they've released an "ultimate" collection every now and then since C&C4) is not a good way to experience this game, although if you have no issues with the game personally then go on and enjoy yourself.

184232904.review: 非常好玩的游戏，致敬经典

184206835.review:
Bu oyun çıkalı zaten 15 yıl olduğu için düşüncelerimi sınırlamaya gerek yok.

Red Alert 2 tonlarca kez baştan sona bitiren biri olarak rahatça söylebilirim ki Red Alert 3'ü ilk gördüğüm andan beri alışamadım. Sürekli olarak gösterdikleri meşhur "japonyanın sovyetlerii işgali" intro videosu var ya? Büyük devasa robotlar binaları çiğneyerek geçiyor. Sonra hem havada hem karada dönüşüm yapabilen uçaklar var ufak ufak küçük robotlar var vs.
İlk bu videoyu gördüğüm an "aga bunlar niye böyle tuhaf tuhaf şeyleri oyuna koymuşlar ki???" dedim.

RA2'de bunlar yoktu öyle işte. Yine absürt üniteler olmasına rağmen o oyunda bazı bilimsel tasarımlardan yola çıkarak tasarımlar yapıyorlardı. Örneğin Tesla Tank (meşhur Nikola Tesla tasarımlarından) ya da Prism tank (benzerlerini büyük ihtimal gelecekte göreceğimiz tarzda) ya da Weather Storm (şimdi bile depremlere sebep olan makineler olduğunu iddaa edenler var. Hava olaylarını kontrol edebilen bir tasarım çok mu ütopik?).

RA3'te ise pek çok tasarımı sadece havalı oldukları gibi yapmışlar gibi görünüyor. Örneğin "Hadi King Oni'yi Evangelion'dan alalım" yada "Hadi Yuriko'yu Akira'dan esinlenelim!" tarzı gitmişler gibi gözüküyor. Bunda yanlış bir şey olmamasına rağmen benim RA2'de sevdiğim şey bu değildi. Ben tüm bu ünite ve factionları havalı göründükleri içinde değil işlevleri ve orjinal tasarımları yüzünden seviyordum. RA3'te bunu hissedemedim.

Campaign zaten kendisi apayrı bir rezalet. Eğer bu oyunu oynamadan bu yazıyı okuyan varsa ben direk ne ile karşılaşacağınızı özetleyeyim:
- Biz Komutan A olarak göreve başlıyoruz. Komutan B bizim patronumuz oluyor. Komutan C ise bizim patronumuzun patronu oluyor. Bölümler ilerledikçe biz düşmanı yok ediyoruz. Sonra bir anda Komutan C bizim düşmanımız oluyor. Sonra komutan C'yi de yok ediyoruz. (Japonya campaign'i hariç diğer hepsi böyle)
- Oyunda kadın karakterlerin hepsi sırf görüntüleri için orada. RA2'de de buna benzer şeyler vardı ama bu oyunu yapan stüdyo hollywood'un filmlerde kadınları gösterdiği gibi oyunda da gösterebileceklerini zannetmiş herhalde.
- Çoğu görev "bir şeyi koru" ya da "bir şeyi belli bir zaman içerisinde yok et" görevi. Japonya ve ABD görevlerini zorda oynarken kaç kez kafayı yemek üzereydim. Çoğunda orjinalik yoktu.
- Tüm hikaye "zaman yolculuğu" muhabbetiyle geçiyor ve bu konuda başka HİÇBİR açıklama yapmıyorlar. Hikaye öyle kendi kendine yuvarlanı gidiyor.

Tüm bunlara rağmen RA3'ün oyun mekanikleri ve faction'ların birbiriyle tutarlılığı açısından yeterli olduğunu düşünüyorum. Hepsini kendi stratejileri var ve o kısmı iyi yapmışlar. Benim asıl derdim bu oyunun dışa vuruşu yani dış personası. Belki de burada yapılan yanlış seçimler bugün RA4 olmamasının sebeplerinden biri olabilir.
